title: 106_hr5370
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk as follows:

"SECTION 1. FINDINGS." The Congress finds that Professor Peter F. Drucker, a renowned figure in modern management, was born in Vienna, Austria, and later moved to the United States where he published influential books on management practices. Peter F. Drucker, a renowned figure in modern management, has authored numerous best-selling books on management, economics, politics, and society. He has also written novels, essays, and is a regular contributor to magazines and journals. Drucker's latest book is "Managing the Non-Profit." Peter F. Drucker, a prominent figure in modern management, published his latest book, "Managing the Non-Profit," in November 1990. Drucker is known for his contributions to management theory, including the concept of "management by objectives" and the recognition of the importance of knowledge workers. He has served as an advisor to CEOs of major corporations and has held teaching positions at Bennington College and New York University. Peter F. Drucker, the Marie Rankin Clarke Professor of Social Science and Management at the Peter F. Drucker Graduate School of Management, has revolutionized management theory and practice. His contributions include helping General Electric's jet engine division understand customer value systems and revolutionizing modern business techniques. Peter F. Drucker revolutionized management techniques for modern businesses, strengthening their foundations. The President is authorized to present a gold medal to Peter F. Drucker for his accomplishments as a journalist, writer, economist, and philosopher. The Secretary of the Treasury will design and strike the medal. Duplicates in bronze may be sold under regulations set by the Secretary. The medals authorized by this Act are national medals under title 31, United States Code. Up to $30,000 from the Mint Public Enterprise Fund will cover the costs. Proceeds from bronze medal sales will go back into the Fund.
